intro: Cyrtandra grandibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while the flowers are clustered in inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
